fields.title: Netlink NBN Trust
fields.body: Stable business trust represents fibre-connections. Major risks include 5G rollout but analysts say that this may even be beneficial to the trust.
fields.rationale: Safe counter with a low beta that can be good collateral for a margin account.

fields.title: Keppel Infrastructure Trust
fields.body: Business trust that is in this business of chemicals, waste management and gas. Deferred capex from pandemic lowered distributable income. Also hit by higher tariffs.
fields.rationale: Even at lower yields, the trust remains a table choice to lower the volatility of a portfolio.

fields.title: SIA
fields.body: Singapore Airlines Ltd. engages in passenger and cargo air transportation. It operates through the following segments: Singapore Airlines, SilkAir, Budget Aviation and SIAEC. The Singapore Airlines segment provides passenger air transportation under the Singapore Airlines brand with a focus on full-service passenger serving short and long haul markets. The SilkAir segment covers passenger air transportation under the SilkAir brand with a focus on full-service passenger serving regional markets. The Budget Aviation segment provides passenger air transportation under the Scoot brand with a focus on the low cost passenger segment. The SIAEC segment provides airframe maintenance and overhaul services, line maintenance, technical ground handling services and fleet management. The company was founded on January 28, 1972 and is headquartered in Singapore.
fields.rationale:
Not recommended because forecasted revenue is too low to overcome the overheads which will result in negative cashflow. 
No vaccine yet. 
Longer than expected shutdown in global international travel as various countries keep the travel ban and restrictions on inbound tourists in place in order to prevent imported cases of Covid-19.

fields.title: YangZiJiang
fields.body:
Strong uptrend in ocean rates. Positive outlook could lead to more orders. Order momentum catch up, received $700M USD orders YTD. On track to hit USD 1.1b.
Shipyard in 100% operation, works can proceed. 

Better Outlook in 2021, increase ship rates may encourage ship owner to invest in more vessels, which lead to high utilization of shipyard.
fields.rationale:
Analyst - ADD
Target Price - upside 40%
Dividend - consistently at 4.36% for next 4 years
P/E - 6.4
Free Float - 38% (cashflow is healthy)
Dividend payout ratio - 0.344
Stable quarter to quarter profit

Recommendation: BUY

fields.title: Keppel Corp
fields.body: Keppel Corporation Limited, an investment holding company, engages in the offshore and marine, property, infrastructure, and investment businesses in Singapore, China, Hong Kong, Brazil, other Far East and ASEAN countries, and internationally. It constructs, fabricates, and repairs offshore production facilities and drilling rigs, power barges, specialized vessels, and other offshore production facilities; engineers, constructs, and fabricates platforms for the oil and gas sector; undertakes shipyard works and other general business activities; and procures equipment and materials for the construction of offshore production facilities.
fields.rationale:
Buy

Analysis
-The current valuation implies negative equity for KEP's O&M business, which we think is unwarranted as the O&M order book of more than S$4bn is in progress and should be able to guide the yard into profitability in FY21F. 

-High Target price of SGD 6.46 (high potential upside)

fields.title: Keppel DC REIT
fields.body: Keppel DC REIT, the first data centre real estate investment trust (DC REIT) listed in Asia, invests in a diversified portfolio of income-producing real estate assets used primarily for data centre purposes.
fields.rationale:
Low Gearing 35.2% at 3Q20 to meet growth expenditure
Capital Expenditure CAGR increase by 22% in next 5 years
Global mobile increase by 31% annually from 2019 to 2025
> 40% potential growth in European data centres
growth estimates >10% annum in next 5 years

fields.title: UOL
fields.body: UOL Group Ltd. engages in the investments in properties, subsidiaries, associated companies, and listed and unlisted securities. It operates through the following segments: Property Development, Property Investments, Hotel Operations, Investments, and Others. The Property Development segment refers to the development of properties for sale. The Property Investment segment includes the leasing of commercial properties and serviced suites. The Hotel Operations segment operates owned hotels. The Investments segment invests in quoted and unquoted financial assets. Its portfolio includes residential units, office towers and shopping malls, hotels, and serviced suites. The company was founded in 1963 and is headquartered in Singapore.
fields.rationale:
Analyst report on the sector: Overweight (Weak Buy). However, we recommend not to buy. 
1) The target price is not much higher than the current price
2) Majority of their returns (37%) come from residential units and commercial development, which is good as there are more property sales in the market now. However, they are still weighted down by the poor hospitality sector which account for 29% of their portfolio. 

Projected yield not attractive enough to include this counter into the portfolio.

fields.title: Mapletree Commerial Trust
fields.body: Mapletree Commercial Trust is a Singapore-focused real estate investment trust (“REIT”) that invests on a long-term basis, directly or indirectly, in a diversified portfolio of income-producing real estate used primarily for office and/or retail purposes, whether wholly or partially, in Singapore, as well as real estate related assets. MCT’s portfolio comprises VivoCity, Mapletree Business City, PSA Building, Mapletree Anson and MLHF. These five assets have a total NLA of 5.0 million square feet with a total value of S$8.9 billion.
fields.rationale:
Buy

Bluechip, strong track record and good management. 

Believe in C19 recovery. Strong balance sheet. Currently valuations are "undemanding".

fields.title: UOB
fields.body:
Less bad, but not the great as compare to peers.
NIM pressures to remain as loans continue to price downwards.
Low interest margin.
fields.rationale:
Analyst - Negative from Maybank Kim Eng
NIM - Bottomed, but low momentum 
NPL - Rising (1.6%) 
Slow credit charge momentum
P/E - 11.6

Recommendation: Not to Buy

fields.title: Creative Technology Ltd
fields.body: Creative Technology Ltd, together with its subsidiaries, designs, manufactures, and distributes digital entertainment products worldwide. The company offers digitized sound and video boards, computers, and related multimedia and personal digital entertainment products.
fields.rationale:
Exclude from portfolio

Have not paid dividend since 2015. Have not produced any notable innovative technology products in the past few years.

fields.title: DBS
fields.body: Singapore National Bank
fields.rationale:
NIM has bottomed, so possible rebound soon.
non-NIM fees are already on the recovery.
Analysts are conservatively forecasting medium-term (1.5-2 years?) growth/recovery of >9%.
Dividend yields are still ok at approx. 4.7% and above. Looking to increase as business picks up as travel bubbles improve covid-19 frontline business and in turn reduces NPLs.
Digital Fintech edge should assist in maintaining their position in the face of the rise of digital banking.

fields.title: Hi-P International Limitied
fields.body: Hi-P International Ltd. is an investments holding company, which engages in the manufacture of insert molding and metal forming tool. It operates through the following segments: Precision Plastic Injection Molding, Mold Design and Fabrication, and Assembly. The Assembly segment offers sub-product assembly and full-product assembly services. The company was founded by Hsiao Tung Yao in 1980 and is headquartered in Singapore.
fields.rationale:
Analysts recommend actions of buy and hold. However, the current price has exceeded the target price.

The number of customers supporting their main business is not sufficiently diversified [5 major customers accounting for 87% of PPIM segment, 7 customers accounting for 74% in assembly segment). 

Recommended not to buy now.

fields.title: Fu Yu
fields.body:
Free Float - 60%
Rich in cash, zero borrowing
Expected net profit to grow moving forward, stable (above average) dividend yield
fields.rationale:
Free Float - 60%
Rich in cash, zero borrowing
Expected net profit to grow moving forward, stable (above average) dividend yield
P/E - 12.4

Recommendation: BUY

fields.title: AEM
fields.body:
Semiconductors & Semiconductor Equipment / Semiconductors and Semiconductor Equipment
Manufacture 5G chips and AI systems
fields.rationale:
Holds a patent for a highly commercialised process (Tech edge).
Potential for acquisition (>20%?) / may be listed in NasDaq when share prices hit USD1 billion (share price of S$5.30).

fields.title: Parkway Life
fields.body:
Dividend yield stable
Target price reached, but have room to grow when medical tourism resume
fields.rationale:
Analyst - Buy
Risk - Master Lease of 15 years (due in 2022)
Healthy Portfolio occupancy rates (100% Singapore and Japan)

fields.title: Dasin Retail Trust
fields.body: Dasin Retail Trust engages in the provision of real estate investment services. It operates through the following segments: Xiaolan Metro Mall, Dasin E-Colour, Ocean Metro Mall, Doumen Metro Mall and Shiqi Metro Mall. The company was founded on January 20, 2017 and is headquartered in Singapore.
fields.rationale:
Analyst recommend to hold and buy. High occupancy of 97% . Projected DPU to go up provided covid situation remains stable. There is a geographical risk as all their malls are allocated in the Zhongshan Bay Area and if something do occur there, it will affect all the malls. 

In addition, their sponsor Zhongshan Dasin Real Estate Co. waived their entitlement to dividends till FY21. After which, there will likely be a high drop in dividends. 

We think that the dividend yield can offset the cons for the time being,

fields.title: FRASERS LOGISTICS & COMMERCIAL TRUST
fields.body: Frasers Logistics & Commercial Trust (“FLCT”) is a Singapore-listed real estate investment trust with a portfolio comprising 99 industrial and commercial properties, worth approximately S$5.7 billion, diversified across five major developed markets – Australia, Germany, Singapore, United Kingdom and the Netherlands
fields.rationale:
Cheapest large-cap logistics REIT in Singapore. 

With a higher TP of S$1.85, FLCT’s target yields are 4.1-4.3% for FY21F-FY22F, which is fair given its substantially freehold portfolio.

ROFR pipeline from Sponsor is worth more than S$5.0bn.

fields.title: Keppel Reit
fields.body: Keppel REIT is one of Asia’s leading REITs with a portfolio of premium Grade A commercial assets in prime business and financial districts pan-Asia. The REIT has assets under management of approximately $8 billion in Singapore, key Australian cities of Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth, as well as Seoul, South Korea.
fields.rationale: Management fee structure incentivize larger AUM rather than growing DPU. No faith in Keppel reit management due to track record.

fields.title: MapleTree Industry Trust
fields.body:
Attractive “land bank” in Singapore. We believe investors have not priced in the “value” in MINT portfolio. 
Another acquisition for data centre and office property in Virginia, USA. Data centre on freehold land and already has existing tenants.
Strong Growth Prospect - Proliferation of 5G technology will help to bump up demand for data centres.
fields.rationale:
Analyst - BUY
Strong Growth prospect - due to recent data centre acquisition, strong customer retention
Stable dividend yield

fields.title: Suntec Reit
fields.body: Suntec Real Estate Investment Trust engages in the ownership of income-producing real estate, which is primarily used for retail and office purposes. The firm operates through the following business segments: Office, Retail and Convention. The Office segment comprises of Suntec city, park mall, and pacific highway. Its portfolio comprises office and retail properties in Singapore and Australia. The company was founded on November 1, 2004 and is headquartered in Singapore.
fields.rationale: Their recent DPU has dropped by 20% causing a drop in share prices. They have 5 property investments in Australia, with 2 in Melbourne which is experiencing a lockdown and this could affect their revenue. In addition, revenue from MICE is muted due to restrictions in place, unless Phase 3 commence, it does not look promising for Suntec REIT.

fields.title: Manulife US REIT
fields.body: Manulife US REIT is a Singapore listed REIT established with the investment strategy principally to invest, directly or indirectly, in a portfolio of income-producing office real estate in key markets in the United States, as well as real estate-related assets.
fields.rationale:
Long leases of 5.7 years(WALE), high occupancy of 96.2% and resilience of quality office tenants (gov, tech, finance, legal). Manulife offers an attractive FY20e DPU yield of 8.7%.
Some room for growth (potentially. >15%) as well.

fields.title: Fraser Centerpoint Trust
fields.body: Frasers Centrepoint Trust (“FCT”) is a leading developer-sponsored retail real estate investment trust listed on the SGX-ST. FCT is focused on delivering regular and stable distribution to its unitholders through its investments in quality income-producing retail properties in Singapore and overseas, and to achieve long-term growth in net asset value.
fields.rationale: Aggressive expansion (north and northeast heartland areas, with highest young population growth rate), eventually 52% of SG population. Will become second largest capitaland mall trust.
